meta.description: Bold, provocative design tokens for dual-perspective debate UI. Emphasizes visual tension, contrast, and cognitive friction.
meta.color_scheme: dual-mode (supports both light and dark with aggressive contrast)

colors.comment: CRITICAL: This brand uses OPPOSING color pairs to represent Believer vs. Skeptic. Never mix these colors in the same component.

believer.description: Sky blue - represents trust, confirmation, optimism

skeptic.description: Red - represents danger, skepticism, critical thinking

judge.description: Purple - represents wisdom, synthesis, final verdict

foreground.description: Near-white text for readability against dark backgrounds

border.description: Subtle borders that don't distract from content

accent.description: Amber - used for CTAs and attention-grabbing elements

design_principles: ALWAYS show Believer and Skeptic content in side-by-side columns with clear color coding
Use sharp corners and strong borders to emphasize division and conflict
Prefer dark backgrounds with high-contrast text (near-black bg + near-white text)
Use glow effects sparingly but dramatically for agent-specific highlights
Typography should be clean and highly readable - Inter for body, JetBrains Mono for code
Animate transitions to show 'tug of war' between competing arguments
